intro: Fimbristylis crassispica, commonly known as the thick-hair sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pale green to brown in color. Its inflorescence consists of a dense spike of spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family. The plant is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
